title: Data Science Life Cycle
subject: Data Science
theory: The Data Science life cycle is a standard workflow. A popular framework is OSEMN: Obtain, Scrub, Explore, Model, Nterpret. Another is CRISP-DM: Business Understanding, Data Understanding, Data Preparation, Modeling, Evaluation, Deployment.

common_mistakes.correction: Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) is crucial. Jumping straight to modeling often leads to poor results due to misunderstood data.

interview_questions.question: Which step consumes the most time in Data Science?
interview_questions.answer: Data Cleaning and Preparation usually takes 60-80% of the project time.

real_world_use_cases.description: Requires rigorous data cleaning (Scrub) and validation (Evaluate) before deployment due to financial regulations.

exam_notes: OSEMN: Obtain, Scrub, Explore, Model, Interpret.
summary: A structured lifecycle ensures projects address business goals and produce reliable models.
